intro: Sphaeralcea densiflora, commonly known as the denseflower globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and open plains. Its leaves are usually gray-green and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Sphaeralcea densiflora is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar morphological features.
